Title: Double-page Illuminated Frontispiece
Medium: ink and pigments on laid paper
Description: This folio from Walters manuscript W.600 is the left side of a double-page illuminated frontispiece that precedes the preface of the text. The inscriptions are not legible.
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Safavid; Book; Codex; Colophon; Illumination;* Illustration; Manuscript; Iran; History; Literature -- Poetry
Provenance: Ahmad [date and mode of acquisition unknown] [seal impression with name on fol. 1a]; Unknown owner, 1789 [mode of acquisition unknown] [ownership entry dated 12 Jumad√° I 1204 AH/AD 1789 on fol. 1a]; Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Firdawsi (Persian, died 411-416 AH/AD 1020-1025)
